public class WireFrameView
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.FocusPanel
implements Drawable

This class allows the viewing of a 3D ObjWireFrame. It uses a simple orthogonal projection. It has functions that allow the rotation of the ObjWireFrame around all three axes. The z-rotation is applied first, then the y-rotation, then finally the x-rotation. Positive-y is upwards.

Author:
Joshua Little

Constructor Detail

WireFrameView

public WireFrameView(ObjWireFrame wireFrame,
                     int width,
                     int height)
Creates an instance of WireFrameView. The x- and y-rotation will be set to their respective default values.

Parameters:
wireFrame - the wire-frame to draw.
width - the width of the canvas.
height - the height of the canvas.
See Also:
DEFAULT_X_ROTATION, DEFAULT_Y_ROTATION
Method Detail

getWireFrame

public ObjWireFrame getWireFrame()
Returns the currently drawn wire-frame. This wire-frame will not reflect any transformations applied to the view.

Returns:
the wire-frame currently being drawn.
See Also:
setWireFrame(ObjWireFrame)

setWireFrame

public void setWireFrame(ObjWireFrame wireFrame)
Sets the wire-frame to draw. Does not reset any of the current transformations.

Parameters:
wireFrame - the wire-frame to draw.

reset

public void reset()
Resets this WireFrameView. Changes the rotation to their default rotations.

See Also:
DEFAULT_X_ROTATION, DEFAULT_Y_ROTATION

getSurface

public gwt.g2d.client.graphics.Surface getSurface()
Returns the underlying canvas surface that this WireFrameView draws on. Drawing on this will result in an immediate change to the resultant view.

Returns:
the underlying canvas surface.

setLineColor

public void setLineColor(gwt.g2d.client.graphics.Color lineColor)
Changes the line color used to draw the wire-frame. draw() will need to be called manually for the changes to take effet.

Parameters:
lineColor - the new line color to draw the wire-frame in.
See Also:
getLineColor()

getLineColor

public gwt.g2d.client.graphics.Color getLineColor()
Returns the line color used to draw the wire-frame.

Returns:
the line color used to draw the wire-frame.

getRotateX

public double getRotateX()
Returns the current x-rotation of this WireFrameView. The returned number will be between 0 and two pi, inclusive.

Returns:
the current x-rotation.

getRotateY

public double getRotateY()
Returns the current y-rotation of this WireFrameView. The returned number will be between 0 and two pi, inclusive.

Returns:
the current y-rotation.

getRotateZ

public double getRotateZ()
Returns the current z-rotation of this WireFrameView. The returned number will be between 0 and two pi, inclusive.

Returns:
the current z-rotation.

rotateX

public void rotateX(double dx)
Changes the x-rotation by the supplied amount. Positive values rotate the y-axis towards the z-axis.

Parameters:
dx - the amount to increase the x-rotation by.
See Also:
setRotateX(double)

rotateY

public void rotateY(double dy)
Changes the y-rotation by the supplied amount. Positive values rotate the z-axis towards the x-axis.

Parameters:
dy - the amount to increase the y-rotation by.
See Also:
setRotateY(double)

rotateZ

public void rotateZ(double dz)
Changes the z-rotation by the supplied amount. Positive values rotate the x-axis towards the y-axis.

Parameters:
dz - the amount to increase the z-rotation by.
See Also:
setRotateZ(double)

rotate

public void rotate(double dx,
                   double dy)
Changes the x- and y-rotations by the supplied amounts. Positive dx values rotate the y-axis towards the z-axis, and positive dy values rotate the z-axis towards the x-axis.

Parameters:
dx - the amount to increase the x-rotation by.
dy - the amount to increase the y-rotation by.
See Also:
setRotate(double, double), rotateX(double), rotateY(double)

rotate

public void rotate(double dx,
                   double dy,
                   double dz)
Changes the x-, y-, and z-rotations by the supplied amounts. Positive dx values rotate the y-axis towards the z-axis, positive dy values rotate the z-axis towards the x-axis, and positive dz values rotate the x-axis towards the y-axis.

Parameters:
dx - the amount to increase the x-rotation by.
dy - the amount to increase the y-rotation by.
dz - the amount to increase the z-rotation by.
See Also:
setRotate(double, double, double), rotateX(double), rotateY(double), rotateZ(double)

                      double rotY,

Sets the x-, y-, and z-rotations to the supplied values. Positive dx values rotate the y-axis towards the z-axis, positive dy values rotate the z-axis towards the x-axis, and positive dz values rotate the x-axis towards the y-axis.

Parameters:
rotX - the new x-rotation value.
rotY - the new y-rotation value.

draw

public boolean draw()
Draws this WireFrameView's wire-frame onto the view. Will only draw if it has been invalidated, whether be changing its wire-frame or rotation, or by calling invalidate().

Specified by:
draw in interface Drawable
Returns:
whether the Drawable ended up redrawing itself.
See Also:
redraw()

redraw

public void redraw()
Forces this WireFrameView to redraw itself.

Specified by:
redraw in interface Drawable
See Also:
draw()

invalidate

public void invalidate()
Invalidates this WireFrameView so that it will be forced to redraw itself on the next call to draw().

Specified by:
invalidate in interface Drawable
See Also:
redraw()

drawBuffer

private void drawBuffer()
Draws the transformed wire-frame onto the canvas. Should be preceded by a call to recomputeBuffer().

insertionZSort

private void insertionZSort(Face[] faces)
Z-sorts the faces in place according to their maximum transformed z-coordinate in ascending order. Uses insertion sort.

Parameters:
faces - the array of faces to sort.

findMaxZ

public double findMaxZ(Face face)
Finds the maximum z-coordinate of the supplied face's transformed vertices. Run-of-the-mill find-maximum algorithm.

Parameters:
face - the face to transform over.
Returns:
the maximum z-coordinate.

recomputeBuffer

private void recomputeBuffer()
Rebuilds all buffered values.

reconstructBuffer

private void reconstructBuffer()
Rebuilds all of the buffer arrays. Used when changing the wire-frame.

See Also:
setWireFrame(ObjWireFrame)

transformPoints

private void transformPoints()
Transforms all of the vertices and normals in the wire-frame. Simply rotates them and projects them. The resultant transformed vertices, normals, and projected vertices are stored in tVertices, tNormals and vPoints, respectively.

See Also:
generateRotMatrix(), project(Point3D, Vector2)

generateRotMatrix

private void generateRotMatrix()
Computes rotMatrix so that multiplying points by it rotates them according to this WireFrameView's current rotations. Applies the z-rotation, then the y-rotation, and then the x-rotation.

project

private void project(Point3D p3,
                     gwt.g2d.client.math.Vector2 p2)
Projects the point in 3D wire-frame space into 2D view space. Standard orthogonal projection: just drops the z-coordinate. y is negated so that because +y is up in wire-frame space, but -y is up in view space.

Parameters:
p3 - the 3D point to transform.
p2 - the 2D point to store the result in.
